segments.text: can I see your passport , please ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: is this line for non-residents ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: yes it is . Residents can queen up in the lines to my right .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok . Here's my passport .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: what's the expiration date on your passport ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think it's soon , maybe in a few months . It was renewed in Beijing , so the new expiry date is on the last page .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Yes , you'll need to renew your passport in a few months . Make sure you don't let it expire while you are in the UK .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I won't .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: do you have anything to declare ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: no , I don't have anything to declare .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: how long will you be staying in the UK ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll be here for about a year .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: what is the purpose of your stay ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'll be studying . I'm doing an MBA at Nottingham University .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: where will you be staying ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I have a housing contract with the university . I'll be in a dorm room on campus .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: how do you plan on paying for your living costs and tuition fees while you are here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: my father has already paid for that in advance . Here are the receipts .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: ok . Have a good day . Here's your passport and documents back .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: thank you very much .
segments.speaker: S2
